name: Rah, Rah, Like a Dungeon Dragon Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"I can be selfish, feel so impatient.  Sometimes I feel like..."

This song has the name of a famous person as a title.  Which one?
questions.explanation:
Marilyn Monroe.

	"Marilyn Monroe" was not released as a single until December of 2012, but charted only a week after the album's release (in April 2012) due to digital downloads.  It was her sixth single from the album.

questions.text:
"I can't control the way I'm moving my hips, bet you never ever seen me like this."

Which of these songs contains the above lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Automatic.

	"Automatic" was released in November 2012 as the fourth international single from the album "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded".  The song isn't about a firearm; rather, it's a song about a reflexive action, an automatic motion.

questions.text:
"So tell dem gyal dem."

This song is a bit hard to understand, because of the way she says things, and looking up the lyrics doesn't really help.  Which song contains the lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Gun Shot.

	"Gun Shot" was released on "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded" in 2012, and was sung by Nicki Minaj.  The song also features a rapper named Beenie Man.

questions.text:
"Topical discussion, beat it like a percussion."

Which Nicki Minaj song contains the lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Masquerade.

	"Masquerade" was released in April on Nicki Minaj' album "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded".  It was originally written for an Adidas commercial along with Britney Spears, but time restraints meant removing Spears and making it a solo Minaj song.  Interestingly, the song was not including on the re-release of the album, but was again added to the deluxe edition.

questions.text:
"It all comes down to this.  I miss your morning kiss."

This song, a duet, was called what?
questions.explanation:
Right By My Side.

	"Right By My Side" was released as Nicki Minaj's second single off her second album in March 2012.  The song features Chris Brown with vocals.  The official music video, however, features rapper Nas.

questions.text:
"Oh, oh, come and fill my glass up a little more, we bout to get up and burn this floor."

A nice party song, what is the name of this Minaj tune?
questions.explanation:
Pound the Alarm.

	"Pound the Alarm" was released as the fourth single from "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded" in July 2012.  The song gained quite a lot of success, reaching the top ten lists of several countries.

questions.text:
"Let's go to the beach, each, let's go get away.  They say, what they gonna say?"

This is a line from which Nicki Minaj song?
questions.explanation:
Starships.

	"Starships" was the lead single from Minaj's second album, "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded".  It was released in Frebruary 2012.  The song broke records; it was not only Minaj's most successful song to date upon release, it also broke the Black Eyed Peas' "I Got a Feeling" record.  The record was this; the longest time a song appeared in the US Top Ten after debuting in the top ten.  The Black Eyed Peas managed 20 weeks in 2009, but Minaj made it to 21 weeks in 2012.

questions.text:
"Just met a boy, just met a boy when he could come inside of my playpen."

From which Nicki Minaj song do these lyrics belong?
questions.explanation:
Va Va Voom.

	"Va Va Voom" was originally going to be the debut single from "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded", but was replaced by "Starships" instead.  The song did make it on to the deluxe album, though.  It was not released as a single, however, until it appeared on "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded - The Re-Ups".

questions.text:
"Do-do-do-don't let me die young.  I just want you to father my young."

This song was released as a single for someone else originally, with Minaj featured as vocals, but also appeared on her album later.  What's the song?
questions.explanation:
Turn Me On.

	"Turn Me On" was released in December 2011 as the fifth single from David Guetta's fifth album, "Nothing But the Beat".  Nicki Minaj sang the vocals of the song, and in April 2012, the song appeared on the deluxe "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded" album.

questions.text:
"Take your medication, Roman, take a short vacation Roman, you'll be okay."

Which song by Minaj contains these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Roman Holiday.

	"Roman Holiday" was released in April 2012, upon the release of Minaj's album "Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded".  The line in the question was sung by Nicki's alter-ego's mother, Martha Zolanski (still voiced by Minaj, however).  The song was performed in February at the 54th Grammy Awards, which gained much controversy.
